mxfile.agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:121.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/121.0

mxCell.value: I am Zarbalatrax, King of Shadow Time
It's good to see you, old friend. We've had many incredible experiences together.
I see you don't recognize me. I've known you for as long as you've been you... and before.
SILLY MORTAL! You make me laugh! I have a wonderful vacation home there.
Enough babble. I need your help. Will you trust me?
You find yourself in a clearing. There is a large tree on a Hill, an abandoned house, and a large boulder.
You wake up bound to a chair. A singular candle lights the dungeon. You hear a rat scurring across the floor. An owl is lit by the candle.
You find yourself in a decrepid alley. A siren in the distance. There are a few garbage cans, and a cracked window.
You hit the dirty, wet ground. The rodent snickers.
Ask the Rat to cut you free.

The DIRTY RAT laughs at you. He holds a small, rusty sword.

"LOOKING A LITTLE DOWN ON YOUR LUCK, HUH?"
Wait! How did I get here?
You are shrouded in darkness. You spend the next week slowly starving to death. Your calls for help fall upon the dank concrete walls.
You turn down a 90 degree corner to what you think is the street. You're hit with a dead end. At the end of the alley is a mangled, exposed animatronic with a guitar.

Inside the dumpster is a RACCOON. He's got a deep Boston Accent.
"The Hell You Lookin' At?!"

The bizarre beast picks the strings of it's guitar. His voice is smooth and deep, despite his appearance.
"You lost, buddy?"
"Oh... that specter. He's a trickster. What do you seek of him?"
"A wayward spirit. A ghost. Used to be the bell of the ball, and now.. well, look at me."
"He's beyond helping. You're not the first, you know. To be roped into this dangerous game. Hell, you may already be dead."
"Heh, you're stupider than I thought... Fine, for entertainment's sake, you can find him at THE ARCADE."
"He's playing you like a damn fiddle. If you can't see that, you're too far gone."

"Then you are too dangerous to let live!"
The Animatronic Beast unleashes a horrible roar, and lunges at you.
You perish, as he eats you alive.

"Hmm. There may be hope for you still.
You can find him at THE ARCADE."
The RACCOON lunges at you, teeth bared. He tears your throat out.
I'm sorry. I didn't know you could talk.
"Fuck's wrong with you? Never seen a rad Rac' like me? Call me Jumbo!"
The RACCOON scurries in your grip, clawing a gnawing on your hand. Blood explodes from it.
"Alright, alright! I'll tell you whatever you want, just please, don't hurt me!"

In college, I got too drunk at a party. I got in a fight in a back alley. I couldn't stop myself. My girlfriend at the time begged me to stop, but I couldn't until... well... he's paralyzed from the neck down. I never got to apologize. He didn't press charges.

The raccoon sniffles.
"I've come to terms with it. I'm a better man for it."
"Don't know him personally, but I've partied with his partner, Squambo. A good friend, real good."
The raccoon blushes, or, it might be the blood rushing to his head from you choking him.
"At THE ARCADE! Now, leave me the hell alone!"

"Well, I can, idiot! Fuck you!
The raccoon slams the door of the dumpster shut."
You enter the abandoned building through the cracked window. You hear a pained moan from the next room over. A staircase descends, leading away from the voice.
It's more of a shack than a house up close. One blow from the big bad wolf, and this baby is going down. There is a broken window.
"I won't tell you anything! Leave me alone!"
How many licks to the center of a tootsy pop?

"Who?"
The Owl flaps twice, gliding towards you. It lands, sharp claws on stone. You can't see in the darkness, but can hear the beast next to you.
The Owl shrieks. You've asked the forbidden question. The Owl pecks your head, and you slowly bleed to death.
What can you tell me about him?

The Owl's voice is deeper than you'd expect.
"You've spoken the Beast's name. Now he hears all we say. You've ruined me."
You search for him, he searches for me. Information comes at a price.
Isn't he just an Animatronic Fortune Telling Machine?

He's an eldritch god. An all powerful creature of unspoken power. His most dangerous feature... his tongue. Do not believe what he tells you, friend, he seeks to use you. Laugh at you. Until he is bored of you, and then...
Isn't he just an Animatronic Fortune Telling Machine?
He cuts your head off with laser beams.
HA! That's what he wants you to think. Though to be fair... he's cursed to that box. Trapped in a poor contract.
"I want your firstborn child. On the day of it's 4th year."
The Owl shrieks. The Owl pecks your head, and you slowly bleed to death.
The Owl flicks on a light switch, bathing the dark room in light. You see a staircase leading deeper into the dungeon. The Owl's sharp beaks tear at the ropes binding you to the chair. You are free.

"You fucker!"
The Rat shanks you in the eye.

The rat releases you from your bondage.
"Someone dragged you down here. I saw them."
Will you help me find him?
"I didn't get a good look. It was a man with long dark hair. With lots of rings."
"Of course I know him. He's hilarious. Nobody can dance like he can."
"Do you find me some kind of dunce?"
Any idea where I can find him?
"You can find him at THE ARCADE."
You enter a room that looks like a makeshift operating room. A woman lays on the table, with sunken eyes.
She violently grabs your shoulder. "Please, for the love of God, I need water. Oh... water."

She stares back at you, terrified.
"What do you want?!"
You notice a bottle of water on a table across the room.

You give her the water. Immediately, her face contorts into a demonic shape. Her teeth grow massive and sharp. She becomes a grotesque monster.
In one fell swoop, she bites your head off.
You feel a bizarre kinship with this Old Growth Tree. You touch it, and feel a sense of warmth spread throughout your body. You've never felt so at peace, or at home. You find it hard to move.
You try to break free, and soon realize the only way is to chop off your own hand. There is an axe next to the tree.
You embrace the feeling, and before you know it, more than 300 years have passed. You are now part of the tree.
You chop off your hand. You scream in pain. In shock of what you've done. You panic, and faint.

The woman thrashes around, showing her true colors. Her teeth grow massive and sharp. She becomes a grotesque monster.

"WATER-- GIVE IT TO ME!"
